Ask HN: How to Obsess (A Bit)?
text:
Hello Hacker News!

I've read an interesting thread some time ago called "How to find what I am really good at?"(https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33077489)

I have a similar personality and I have accepted that I simply am unable to choose one or even two things, I simply have too many interests that are just equally meaningful to me as all the others. ADD doesn't help, of course, but I'm not entirely sure it is that relevant.

The problem is of course that I cycle through all of those topics and because the surface is really large, I'm not making too much of progress on any of them - at least when measured externally by comparing to other people who are focused on one thing.

Today I saw a petition about bringing back Henry Cavill to Witcher TV series and it dawned on me.

I surveyed my past, I surveyed people who I know that are really good at something. And there is a pattern.

All those people are more or less obsessed about their fields, whether software engineering, photography, jazz guitar or whatever. Some people are clearly obsessed even by things like TV shows.

In my life, however, I was never obsessed by anything. This realization is quite shocking to me.

I would like to at least try and see what is it like to be obsessed by something. Maybe that is a missing ingredient in my life.

So my question is: how to trigger a mild obsession about something - and if possible, how to do it in a controlled way so that I don't get lost in the rabbit hole.

What are sources of your obsessions, people of HN? Is it possible to trace the reasons back to some root causes?

Thanks!

Ask HN: Litnerd Parent Feedback
text:
TL;DR Litnerd is thinking of opening its platform for B2C soon and I would love your feedback here if you are a parent: https://mntozr88sxz.typeform.com/Litnerd-b2c

About Us: Litnerd offers a K-5 literacy and ELA program to schools and districts (mostly NYC, NJ, PA for now). We publish books by grade level, build a full courseware on top, then turn them into feature films. Watch trailer here: https://youtu.be/Y2cTcqwuzKM

Metrics Since Our YC S21 Launch: Schools have reported up to 86% improvement in student ELA performance in just 4 months of adopting Litnerd.

Why Consider B2C: We have often been asked to open up our product and offer B2C (for ex, this request dominated our HackerNews launch) but we never felt ready to offer something of value to the home-school community. Up until recently, we have been offering a Supplemental (add-on) literacy program to schools. It just wasn’t something we felt parents could benefit from.

What Changed: As of this school year, we now offer schools a Core (full 40 week) literacy program. This means, we can finally start thinking of providing parents a full stand-alone package for their children to support their home-school efforts. We would also like to offer a supplemental add-on for parents who just want additional reading support for their child after-school.

Parent Survey Request: https://mntozr88sxz.typeform.com/Litnerd-b2c

Having said that, serving parents directly is dramatically different than serving schools directly. I know I will benefit tremendously from your feedback as a parent. It should only take about 5-7 minutes. Thank you so much for helping us better understand your needs. I appreciate your time.

- anisa mirza

Show HN: A chat website for people who want to just chat
text:
Hello everyone! I built MeroChat as an alternative to the countless video/group chats out there. In a nutshell: text based, 1-on-1, and platonic interactions only.

It works like this: fill your profile as much as you want for conversation starters and let the site suggest you people to chat with. Suggestions cannot be filtered in any way, only skipped. As a form of moderation, some features are only available after a certain amount of karma has been earned.

Feedback is highly welcomed. You can try it without signing up by clicking on "I want to chat without an account" :)
